intro: Melissa officinalis subsp. inodora, commonly known as lemon balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, slightly lemon-scented leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Its leaves are often used in culinary and medicinal applications due to their calming properties. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, sharing similarities with other mint species.
